etymologies: late Middle English (denoting any red deer stag in its second year, with straight antlers): from Anglo-Norman French broquet, diminutive of broque, variant of broche (see brooch). The current sense dates from the mid 19th century

definitions: a small deer with short straight antlers, found in Central and South America.

notes.text: Genus Mazama, family Cervidae: four species

shortDefinitions: small deer with short straight antlers, found in Central and South America
